solution_line_template: For the swiss cheese, Miley paid {swiss_packs} * {swiss_price_per_pack} = ${<<{swiss_packs}*{swiss_price_per_pack}={cost_swiss_cheese}>>}{cost_swiss_cheese}.
{blue_cheese_grams} grams of blue cheese means {blue_cheese_grams} / {grams_per_package} = <<{blue_cheese_grams}/{grams_per_package}={blue_cheese_packages}>>{blue_cheese_packages} packages.
So for the blue cheese, Miley paid {blue_cheese_packages} * {blue_price_per_pack} = ${<<{blue_cheese_packages}*{blue_price_per_pack}={cost_blue_cheese}>>}{cost_blue_cheese}.

One-third of the blue cheese means {white_cheese_reduction_fraction} * {blue_cheese_grams} = <<{white_cheese_reduction_fraction}*{blue_cheese_grams}={white_cheese_reduction_grams}>>{white_cheese_reduction_grams} grams.
So Miley bought only {blue_cheese_grams} - {white_cheese_reduction_grams} = <<{blue_cheese_grams}-{white_cheese_reduction_grams}={white_cheese_grams}>>{white_cheese_grams} grams of white cheese.
So for the white cheese, Miley paid {white_cheese_packages} * {white_price_per_pack} = ${<<{white_cheese_packages}*{white_price_per_pack}={cost_white_cheese}>>}{cost_white_cheese}.
So in total for all the cheese, Miley paid {cost_swiss_cheese} + {cost_blue_cheese} + {cost_white_cheese} = ${<<{cost_swiss_cheese}+{cost_blue_cheese}+{cost_white_cheese}={total_cost}>>}{total_cost}.
